name: Hotel M, Mount Pocono

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night (sept 16) while going to the Joan Rivers Show (GREAT) an the Mt. Airy Lodge. Mt Airy wanted 300 a night just for a room. They have no pool??? For a third of that cost we got Quality Inn. Very nice room, indoor pool, breakfast. and only a 5 min drive. Very nice restaurant, Baileys Steakhouse next door. Very basic hotel. Room was Clean, friendly staff , Had better Breakfast but it was Free. Well worth the price.
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.text: when we entered the room, there was trash left in the room from other clients, the door to our room would not lock , told manger who said they would try to fix it. didn't show up to fix it. was suppose to have fruit for breaksfast, had old dried up oranges that is it. My mom's room had a hornets nest in the vent, had to move her to another room and they down graded her room.
reviews.title: we hated it! would not stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend not staying on the ground floor. We had ants crawling up our wall (I assume trying to get to the food we brought and had on the table). Our pillows didn't have pillowcases and the pillows were disgusting. I couldn't sleep on them after they put the pillowcases on because I saw how gross the pillows were.
reviews.title: So-so

reviews.text: The front desk staff were exceptional! Very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Decent price at a decent place

reviews.text: If my room were cleaner than I would rate this hotel higher. I would say it's comparable to a 2-star hotel. It was very quiet and the continental breakfast was nice.
reviews.title: What a Dump
Don't stay without a "UV light"
reviews.text: While meeting up with my with my parents for a one night stay at the Quality Inn and Suites, Mt. Pocono in the off season, I had expected a great rate. I booked a family suite at $107.00, which included a king non-smoking room with a side room with bunk beds for my 11 year old sun. We arrived late in the day and check in was smooth. We were told to park in the rear and come up the back elevator.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The door to enter in the rear was smashed and broken. There was a second interior door with a key lock into the location, but the smashed door was concerning. We arrived in the room and all looked well, so we started to settle in, when we noticed a number of stains on pieces of furniture.
reviews.title: The worst hotel EVER!!!
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
reviews.text: One the bunk bed side table there was a large sticky soda spill that had dried into a sticky hard mess. I pulled out our cleaning wipes and wiped it off. Then I noticed large stains on the side chair. One stain begat another as we started looking around the room. But we were reasonable people, a few stains left by the cleaning staff, just meant they were rushed and didn't get to them right. Well then we went into the bathroom and the odor from the toilet was of definite urine that has gotten in the tile around the edge.

I know, by this time we should have packed up and called down to the front desk, but we were so tired, and it was only one night that we didn't. We just took out our lysol spray we carry with us and made the room inhabitable for the night.
reviews.title: Good value overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before our stay was concluded in the morning we experienced:
reviews.title: Very good deal for the price
UN-quality or NO-quality or Non-quality should be the name
reviews.text: 1. Driveway to get into the parking lot from main road-quality 2. Parking lot full of potholes or cliffs-quality 3. Front entrance with printed out instructions held by tape on the glass doors-quality 4. The dress of the staff at the front desk brings casual to a new standard-quality 5. Back door on far side of hotel broken and wide open but if your key works then it is a bonus because when the wind blows it closed then the key might work-quality 6. Keys don't work-quality 7. Housekeeping forgot to bring hand towels and washcloths with their clean up-quality 8. The front desk answers the phone when you call them about towels because they can tell you to walk from the far end of the hotel to the front desk to get them from there only to find out your key does not work-quality 9. Called the front desk to ask instructions about laundry turn in only to be told by him to bring it to the front desk in the morning only to have the new person on shift tell you that she does not know the procedure and to come back after eight am so that they can find out that they can not do it and the key does not work when you return to your room to secure your dirty laundry-quality 10. Pressing my own shirt with the iron and ironing board in the room which the iron has shmegma on the hot plate and that it does not come off until you have ironed your dress shirt and ruins your shirt and the wobbly ironing board makes a great prop for a jell-o commercial not to mention the great burns it causes when you try and place the iron on the wobbly board to readjust your shirt and the hot iron burns you on the way down to the floor landing on your foot-quality. If you don’t mind these small problems then this is the place for you. Enjoy the quality.

Our family (14yo,7yo, Hubby & I) stayed here overnight while visiting CamelBeach. When we first arrived, the front desk was unmanned and no one was available for check-in. After waiting for 30 minutes to no avail, we decided to go for dinner next door. We should have taken this as a sign, and stayed elsewhere. When we returned from dinner, the attendant didn't seem to care when we told her we had *tried* to check-in earlier. Very rude! After check-in, we found the quality of the room was really horrible. The room was dirty & smelled of mold, the wallpaper was peeling, AC didn't work, lamp was falling apart, lightbulbs not replaced, and the pool was really gross (used bandages scattered around, spa was grimy looking). I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone - even people I don't like!
reviews.title: Yuck! Needs some major work and a deep cleaning

reviews.text: This hotel was very dirty! cigarette butts laying all over the floors in the entrances and exits. The whole hotel smelled of cigarette smoke!The room we had just reeked of smoke! Never ever stay here again!
reviews.title: the worst hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went up for the week end to start Christmas shopping. From the outside with the snow you could not notice potholes and such until the snow melted. From the inside you could see the stained carpets, the lights out in breakfast area. Jacuzzi well why call it that when if you were lucky 2 of the 6 jets worked. Breakfast, well it might have been nice if there were an attendant. The young girl was really a housekeeper who kept leaving to check rooms. The desk staff had to keep coming to refresh things, which then cause a back up with check outs.You could tell the staff was over extended yet they did their best to be friendly.They really do go out of their way to handle all of the problems that were presented to them. Not just by us, we could hear other guest with similar complaints. Plumbing seemed to be a big issue that week end. We needed maintanance and were told he is only part time. Well the place looks like they could use more than one full time person. Even the jacuzzi in the pool are is covered with some unsighlty board. Nothing appealing about the pool area. The walls are peeling. I could go on, but trust me, just save your money and stay away.
reviews.title: what are they thinking

reviews.text: My stay was very nice. The front desk really tried to make my room decision right.
reviews.title: From Tampa to the Poconos

reviews.text: Sorry to be so critical but..... My colleague and I needed a room for a night as were at a week-end conference at Skytop and didn't want to drive back to NYC area after dinner. Unfortunately this property makes an oxymoron of the name Quality Inn and for all the wrong reasons. The property itself is not all that bad. The rooms are comfortable and warm which is all you can expect from a budget hotel in a tourist area.
reviews.title: Aaaggggg - run away

reviews.text: The problem here is the service and the lack of care. Most noticeable in the breakfast room were the food is almost inedible and it is a mess despite the fact there is an attendant there who seemed to be totally disinterested.
reviews.title: A really bad hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place has a management problem.
reviews.title: appalled at the condition of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had to stay this hotel as it was a part of a group package trip to nearby Camelback Mountain and casinos. Stayed in a room on the second floor toward the rear of the hotel, room 256. Room rate was low but there is a reason. In total, the group had six rooms at the hotel, all with similar (but not all) of the issues noted for rm 256.
reviews.title: BED BUG ALERT!!!! I have been chewed up by bed bugs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Issues: (1) clean the HVAC (the air conditioner) filter before you do anything else. Just pull out the filter and rinse under water. You will notice that the filter had never been washed before (unless you stayed in room , then you're welcome.) (2) The microwave had burnt popcorn smell, which forced us to not use it. (3) Shower selector on the tub spout is stuck midway between shower and bath (this was a common theme in all rooms). (A little trick in fixing this is to twist the spout upside down and press down on the plastic tab all the way to get the water flowing fully to the shower.) (4) Hallways were filthy and never cleaned. (5) Indoor pool was filthy beyond belief; more like stepping into a used bathwater after someone else had used it. (6) Free internet, but it is slow and not really wireless.
reviews.title: Would stay again

aka: Quality Inn And Suites Mount Pocono
description: Located in the heart of the Pocono Mountains region, the hotel is close to many area attractions and points of interest. This Mount Pocono, PA hotel is minutes from Mount Airy Casino, Alpine Mountain Ski & Ride Center, Camelback Ski Area, Camelbeach Waterpark and Pocono Raceway.Enjoy hiking and Pennsylvania's beautiful scenery at Bushkill Falls, featuring a series of eight waterfalls, the tallest of which cascades more than 100 feet. We have a convenient location and offer easy access to many nearby industrial parks, riding stables, ski resorts, and canoeing, fishing and white-water rafting areas. Find bargains at the nearby Crossings Premium Outlets shopping mall. A variety of restaurants and cocktail lounges can be found in the surrounding area. Guests of this Mount Pocono, PA hotel will enjoy amenities and features like:Free continental breakfastFree wired and wireless high-speed Internet accessFree local callsFree coffeeAfter a busy day, relax in the indoor heated pool. Be sure to take advantage of our on-site exercise room. Access to copy and fax services is offered for our guests. All guest rooms come equipped with, coffee makers, curved shower rods, hair dryers, irons, ironing boards and cable television. Non-smoking rooms can be requested.Weekly and monthly rates are available; contact the hotel for more details. For added convenience, laundry facilities are located on the premises.Whether traveling to Pennsylvania for business or pleasure, make the hotel your home away from home when visiting the Mount Pocono area. We look forward to serving you soon.
